result.execSummary:
The defendant Hector Francisco Pintor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
- CONCURRENT to count 6
- with credit for 85 DAYS time served. 
- Court granted Huber privileges for work and child care.

miscConds.notes:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment. 
- Absolute sobriety.

- No use of alcohol or any controlled substances. 
- No use of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- No contact with co-defendant D.H. 
- No contact with victims M.A and Cermak Fresh Market. 
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- No use or possession of firearms and ammunition.

- Provide DNA sample. 
- Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. 
- Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hector Francisco Pintor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hector Francisco Pintor not in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Hector Francisco Pintor.  Attorney Dax Odom in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Restitution Hearing. Defendant's appearance is waived. For reasons stated on the record, victim does not wish to seek restitution. Court set restitution at zero.

Defendant Hector Francisco Pintor in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Hector Francisco Pintor.  Attorney Dax Odom in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  However, parties have reached an agreement.  State filed Amended Information.   Defendant acknowledges receipt of Amended Information, waives formal reading, and pleads not guilty.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 6:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  


Sentencing proceeded.
...
Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 6, with credit for 85 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work and child care.  

AS TO COUNT 6:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 1, with credit for 85 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work and child care.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 6:
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 1 YEAR. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Full-time work/school.
- Random drug and alcohol testing. 
- No use of alcohol or any controlled substances.
- No use of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- No use or possession of firearms and ammunition.
- No contact with co-defendant D.H.
- No contact with victims M.A. and Cermak Fresh Market.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 


Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  
20 day appeal rights given. 

Court vacated jury trial date and set the matter over for restitution.
Restitution hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Hector Francisco Pintor
Current: 738 West Washington Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 09-07-2022)
Prior: 2404 W Maple St, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Hector Francisco Pintor not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail motion by the state argued and denied by the Court.
to Reduce Bail, received and filed

Defendant Hector Francisco Pintor in court with Attorney Theodore OReilly; both appear by video.  Defendant Hector Francisco Pintor in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Shipman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Judge Franke.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hector Francisco Pintor not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Attorney O'Reilly to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Cermak Fresh Market; Co-Actor Darnell Hudson; MA;  
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Hector Francisco Pintor in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Hector Francisco Pintor in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hector Francisco Pintor appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
